moves.1. e4 e5 2. Bc4 Nf6 3. Qf3 Nc6 4. c3 d6: Not the best move on White's part. White could have recaptured with the pawn without fear of being taken again by the bishop. Although it does open up a path for my Queen, nothing would really come of that because White's back rank is still too well-protected.
Not a smart move for White. I still have the advantage, as you'll see in the following few moves.
moves.18. Kc1 Bxh1 19. Nf3: White tries to block my Rook from retreating back to my side of the board.
moves.21. a4 Re8 22. Ne5 Bf5 23. Nd2 Qd5 24. c: Not a smart move for white. Now the queen can't intervene when I begin to mate.
moves.28... Bxe5 29. fxe5: The knight was one big obstacle here in preventing a mate, so I got rid of it.
